page.title: 02Hawkhirst Adventure Camp
page.content: The{Hawkhirst Adventure Camp}is managed by The Scout Association, and is a centre providing year-round opportunities for members of the Association and of other recognised youth or educational organisations to develop a wide range of outdoor interests. Residential accommodation is provided in a hostel,whilst the camp provides some 35 camping areas ( total capacity - 1000 campers! ) in its 70 acres of coniferous forest. Activities offered include{dinghy {sailing,canoeing,rowing,sub aqua,board {sailing and fishing,}whilst land-based activities include{orienteering, {backpacking and camping.}Ecology,art and crafts are also catered for at this centre which was opened by Her Majesty Queen Elizabeth II on her visit to Kielder Water on May 26,1982.
